title: Logo Grid
description: Trust signal component for showcasing customer/partner logos. The 'Trusted by...' section found on 80%+ of SaaS homepages.

metadata.description: Trust signal component that displays customer, partner, or integration logos in a visually appealing grid, horizontal scroll, or marquee animation. Industry standard for building credibility and social proof. Supports three layout variants (grid, scroll, marquee), three color schemes (grayscale-hover, grayscale, color), optional clickable logos, and fully responsive with mobile-optimized horizontal scrolling. Critical for conversion optimization on landing pages.

accessibility.notes: All logos include descriptive alt text. Clickable logos are keyboard accessible with clear focus indicators. Marquee animation respects prefers-reduced-motion. High contrast mode disables grayscale filters.

responsive.notes: Responsive grid: 2 columns (mobile), 4 columns (tablet), 6 columns (desktop). Horizontal scroll variant provides touch-friendly scrolling on mobile. Logo size scales down on mobile for optimal display.

performance.notes: Logos use lazy loading for performance. Marquee animation uses CSS transforms with will-change for GPU acceleration. Minimal JavaScript (none required).

statistics: Logo walls increase trust by 42% for unknown brands (Nielsen Norman Group)
23% increase in 'Sign Up' clicks when logos present (Unbounce)
80%+ of SaaS homepages have logo sections
Instant credibility with recognizable brand names
marketingContext.bestLogoCount: 6-8 logos ideal (too few = weak, too many = overwhelming)
realWorldExamples: Stripe: Fortune 500 logos with grayscale hover
Figma: Marquee animation with customer logos
Linear: Clean grid of investor/customer logos
Vercel: Centered grid with grayscale hover
